meanings: (필요한 것을) look[search] for, obtain, (formal) seek; (찾아내다) find (out); (얻다) get
(조언·양해·용서 등을) ask (for), request, (formal) seek, turn to (=청하다)
(위험에서) rescue[save] (sb from sth), (곤경에서) (formal) extricate (sb from sth)
go around looking for a room (to rent)

meanings.meaning: go[come] to the rescue of a person
repair to a shop for tools
set out in search of something

examples.korean: Gunmen continued to snipe at people leaving their homes to find food. 발음듣기 총을 든 자들이 먹을 것을 구하러 집을 나서는 사람들을 계속 저격했다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Gunmen continued to snipe at people leaving their homes to find food. 발음

examples.korean: We’re going house-hunting at the weekend. 발음듣기 우리는 주말에 집을 알아보러[구하러] 다닐 것이다. Oxford Advanced Learner's English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: We’re going house-hunting at the weekend. 발음

examples.korean: The beggar went out into the street for his food. 발음듣기 거지는 먹을 것을 구하러 거리로 나갔다. Friendict Level English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: The beggar went out into the street for his food. 발음

examples.korean: That must be a relief. Apartment hunting can be stressful. 발음듣기 한시름 덜었겠네요. 아파트 구하러 다니는 게 여간 피곤한 게 아니죠. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: That must be a relief. Apartment hunting can be stressful. 발음

examples.korean: Did you have to walk far to get more? 발음듣기 기름 구하러 멀리까지 걸어갔다 왔어요? YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Did you have to walk far to get more? 발음
